intro: Guatteria depressa, commonly known as the dwarf guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Marcaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in areas with humid, shaded environments. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a berry that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
